qas.question: When did Muhammad bin Wasim sail to Pakistan?
Along with the Punjab, what did Muhammad bin Wasim conquer?
At what battle did the Hindus of India defeat the Umayyads?
To what dynasty did Vikramaditya II belong?
Who was a notable king in this period from the Pratihara dynasty?
Who sailed away from Pakistan in 712?
What year did Muhammad bin Qasim leave Pakistan?
What conquests were easy for Umayyad Caliphate?
Who stopped India from invading the Arabs?
When did the south Indian Emperor give up conquering the Arabs?

context: In the year <a0_0><b6_0>712<b6_0/><a0_0/>, <b5_0>Muhammad bin Qasim<b5_0/>, an Umayyad general, sailed from the Persian Gulf into Sindh in Pakistan and conquered both the <a1_0>Sindh<a1_0/> and the Punjab regions along the Indus river. The conquest of <b7_0>Sindh and Punjab<b7_0/>, in modern-day Pakistan, although costly, were major gains for the Umayyad Caliphate. However, further gains were halted by Hindu kingdoms in India in the battle of <a2_0>Rajasthan<a2_0/>. The Arabs tried to invade India but they were defeated by the north Indian <b8_0>king <a4_0>Nagabhata<b8_0/><a4_0/> of the <a3_0>Pratihara<a3_0/> Dynasty and by the south Indian Emperor Vikramaditya II of the Chalukya dynasty in the <b9_0>early 8th century<b9_0/>. After this the Arab chroniclers admit that the Caliph Mahdi "gave up the project of conquering any part of India."
